title: 107_hr3178
content: The "Water Infrastructure Security and Research Development Act" defines key terms like Administrator, research organization, and water supply system. It aims to improve the security of water supply systems through research assistance. The Administrator will establish a research program to improve technologies for water supply system security. Grants will be provided for research on vulnerability assessment, protection technologies, and dissemination of research results to the public. The Administrator will develop programs to disseminate research results on water supply system security, create scientific protocols for system security, conduct research on real-time monitoring systems, develop technologies for mitigation of contamination, and carry out other relevant research activities to enhance water supply system security. The Administrator will establish guidelines, procedures, and criteria for awards to water supply systems, ensuring diversity in project selection and recipients. Awards will be contingent on meeting security conditions. The Administrator will establish guidelines for awards to water supply systems, ensuring diverse recipients. Recipients must meet security and dissemination requirements for research and development activities. The Act does not limit the Administrator's authorities under other laws to award grants or enter agreements for projects. $12,000,000 is authorized for each fiscal year from 2002 to 2006. Funds will remain available until expended.
